steps.title: Use an anthelmintic medication (aka a medicine used to destroy worms).
steps.content: Use an anthelmintic medication (aka a medicine used to destroy worms). Some anthelmintic medicines, like mebendazole, thiabendazole, and albendazole, starve and kill the worms. Other medicines, like ivermectin and praziquantel, paralyze the worms so they pass in your stool. [1] X Research source Ask your doctor about which medicine is the best option for you. Stop by your pharmacy to pick up a prescription if needed. [2] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Note that some deworming medications are available over the counter, in particular medicines to treats pinworms.

steps.title: Take the medication for 1 to 3 days.
steps.content: Take the medication for 1 to 3 days. Your treatment schedule might depend on the type of infection you have—ask your doctor for a more specific treatment plan. [3] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Ask your doctor if your partner, roommates, and/or family members need to take the medication, too. Anyone you live with experiencing symptoms will likely need to take the medication at the same time as you.

steps.title: Yes, but some medications are interchangeable.
steps.content: Yes, but some medications are interchangeable. Tapeworms are usually treated with nitazoxanide, albendazole, or praziquantel, which all require doctor prescriptions. [4] X Research source If you have roundworms, doctors will treat the infection with albendazole. [5] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Pinworms are also treated with albendazole, or mebendazole, a similar medication. [6] X Research source Doctors also treat hookworm with albendazole and mebendazole. [7] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source

steps.title: While home remedies won't hurt you, most are unproven with little evidence showing effectiveness.
steps.content: While home remedies won't hurt you, most are unproven with little evidence showing effectiveness. If you do have worms, medication is a safe, efficient way to get rid of the infection. For those still interested in trying for some natural relief, here are some suggestions. Consuming raw garlic is anecdotally believed by some people to kill pinworm eggs. Antibacterial and antiviral properties of coconut oil could potentially be beneficial both by consuming or by applying topically around the areas affected. Pomegranate has been studied as another natural remedy, but with mostly inconclusive results. [8] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source One study found that dried papaya seeds mixed with honey helped clear worms out of stool. [9] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source However, this was just a pilot study, and this method isn’t officially recommended by other medical websites.

steps.title: You see physical signs of worms.
steps.content: You see physical signs of worms. The next time you use the restroom, take a closer look in the toilet bowl. In some cases, people notice white, thread-like worms in their stool. [10] X Expert Source Muhammad Khan, MD, MPH Board-Certified Gastroenterologist Expert Interview. 24 August 2021. You might also notice a red, worm-shaped rash on your body, or feel really itchy near your bottom. [11] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source

steps.title: You experience stomach pain and your bowel movements are off.
steps.content: You experience stomach pain and your bowel movements are off. Worm parasites can take a big toll on your day-to-day life. You might experience diarrhea , have stomach pains that last longer than 2 weeks, or just feel super lousy. [12] X Expert Source Muhammad Khan, MD, MPH Board-Certified Gastroenterologist Expert Interview. 24 August 2021. In the passing days and weeks, you might also go through unexplained weight loss. [13] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source

steps.title: Try the tape test for 3 days.
steps.content: Try the tape test for 3 days. Pinworm eggs tend to hang around the anus. [14] X Expert Source Muhammad Khan, MD, MPH Board-Certified Gastroenterologist Expert Interview. 24 August 2021. Right after you wake up, stick and remove a piece of clear tape right next to your anus and set it aside in a bag. Keep collecting tape for 3 days before bringing the samples to your doctor, who can look over the tape for eggs. [15] X Research source Always do the tape test first thing in the morning, before you go to the bathroom or change into fresh clothes.

steps.title: No, always visit a doctor to get an official diagnosis.
steps.content: No, always visit a doctor to get an official diagnosis. Your physician might ask you to take a stool sample, where lab technicians can check for worm segments and/or eggs. Your doctor might also take a blood test to look for specific antibodies, or take an imaging test, which can look for signs of an infection. [16] X Research source Although it may be a little inconvenient, your doctor can identify what kind of infection you’re dealing with, and help you figure out a treatment plan. Even if you’re certain you have worms, it’s always best to get a doctor’s confirmation first. Some bacteria, like Escherichia coli (E. coli) have similar symptoms to worm parasites, and can be easy to mix up. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Clean and thoroughly cook all of your food.
steps.content: Clean and thoroughly cook all of your food. Unfortunately, you can catch worms from unwashed produce, or raw/undercooked fish, beef, and pork. [18] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Always wash your fruits and veggies , and cook any meat cuts to at an internal temperature of 145 to 165 °F (63 to 74 °C). [19] X Trustworthy Source Food Safety and Inspection Service of the USDA Food safety information provided by the U.S. Department of Agriculture. Go to source Cook ground meat to an internal temperature of at least 160 °F (71 °C). Experts suggest rubbing your fruits and veggies under a stream of running water. Clean off any firmer produce, like melons and cucumbers, with a clean vegetable brush. Then, dry everything off with a clean paper towel or cloth. [20] X Trustworthy Source US Food and Drug Administration U.S. government agency responsible for promoting public health Go to source

steps.title: Wash your hands frequently with soap and water.
steps.content: Wash your hands frequently with soap and water. Always wash up before preparing any meals or snacks, and whenever you use the restroom. [21] X Expert Source Muhammad Khan, MD, MPH Board-Certified Gastroenterologist Expert Interview. 24 August 2021. [22] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Experts advise washing your hands for 20 seconds, so you get a really thorough clean. [23] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source

steps.title: Keep your home clean.
steps.content: Keep your home clean . Wash any old bedding, sleepwear, and towels where eggs might have collected. Then, vacuum all over your home, especially your sleeping area. Experts also recommend damp dusting around your home, especially near any mattresses, bathroom surfaces, and play areas. To be extra safe, always throw out your damp dusting cloth once you’re done with it, so you don’t accidentally spread eggs around. [24] X Research source To damp dust your home, simply dip a cloth in a cleaning solution and squeeze out any excess liquid. Then, wipe down any dirty surfaces with the cloth. Some parasites, like threadworms , can survive for about 2 weeks around your home. Regular cleaning and laundry cycles can help prevent any new infections. [25] X Research source

steps.title: Practice good hygiene.
steps.content: Practice good hygiene . Take a bath or clean off your anus each morning for 2 weeks, which will get rid of any worm eggs. Also, aim to change into a clean pair of underwear each morning, and wear a close-fitting pair to bed each night. This way, you won’t be as tempted to scratch your bottom. In general, try to wash your hands frequently, and ditch any habits like nail-biting. [26] X Research source

steps.title: Check in with your doctor to be sure.
steps.content: Check in with your doctor to be sure. Your doctor might ask you to submit stool samples once you’ve finished taking your medication. If your stool is consistently clean, your physician can give you a clean bill of health. [27] X Research source Generally, your symptoms should clear up in 2 weeks or less. If the medication doesn’t seem to work, contact your doctor right away. [28] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source
